Generate a poulation full of blocks of 0s and 1s. Only for debugging.

References drand().

00058 {
00059   int i,j,l;
00060 
00061   // generate a population full of 000..0 and 111..1 building blocks
00062   // (used for testing the model building procedure, unnecessary for
00063   // practical applications)
00064 
00065   for (i=0; i<N; i++)
00066     for (j=0; j<n;)
00067       {
00068         int val=(drand()<0.5)? 0:1;
00069         
00070         for (l=0; l<k; l++)
00071           x[i][j++]=val;
00072     };
00073 
00074   // return the number of generated individuals
00075 
00076   return N;
00077 }

Restricted tournament replacement (Harik, 1995) for niching.

Referenced by one_run().

00193 {
00194   int i,j;
00195 
00196   // use default value for window size
00197 
00198   int windowSize=(n<N/20)? n:(N/20);
00199 
00200   // for every individual, do the same
00201 
00202   for (i=0; i<N; i++)
00203     {
00204       // select a random subset from the original population (window) and 
00205       // find the most similar guy to the new individual in this window
00206       // (string Hamming distance)
00207 
00208       int pick=intRand(N);
00209       int dist=individual_distance(x[i],y[pick],n);
00210 
00211       for (j=1; j<windowSize; j++)
00212         {
00213           int pick2=intRand(N);
00214           int dist2=individual_distance(x[i],y[pick2],n);
00215 
00216           if (dist2<dist)
00217             {
00218               pick=pick2;
00219               dist=dist2;
00220             }
00221         }
00222 
00223       // if the most similar guy from the window is better than the new guy,
00224       // the new guy replaces it
00225 
00226       if (fx[i]<fy[pick])
00227         {
00228           memcpy(x[i],y[pick],sizeof(x[i][0])*n);
00229           fx[i]=fy[pick];
00230         }
00231     }
00232 
00233   // return the number of processed new individuals
00234 
00235   return N;
00236 }
